values.alignmentText: Lush mountains, river deltas, and long coastlines offer varied ecosystems, though rapid urbanization and deforestation strain habitats. That helps the family plan around their mild-weather preference and safe outdoor time for the boys.

The Mekong and Red River deltas face severe sea-level rise and saltwater intrusion risks despite national adaptation plans. That helps the family plan around their mild-weather preference and safe outdoor time for the boys.

Tropical monsoon patterns bring hot, humid summers and a drier, cooler season in the north, far more humid than our mild ideal. That helps the family plan around their mild-weather preference and safe outdoor time for the boys.

Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City frequently exceed WHO PM2.5 limits due to traffic and burning, with only seasonal relief. That helps the family plan around their mild-weather preference and safe outdoor time for the boys.

Typhoons, flooding, and occasional landslides are recurring hazards, especially along the central coast. That helps the family plan around their mild-weather preference and safe outdoor time for the boys.

Northern cities run ~20–28°C (68–82°F) with rising humidity; southern hubs stay near 26–34°C (79–93°F). That helps the family plan around their mild-weather preference and safe outdoor time for the boys.

Expect 27–35°C (81–95°F) plus high humidity and heavy monsoon rains, challenging for heat-sensitive family members. That helps the family plan around their mild-weather preference and safe outdoor time for the boys.

Autumn in the north sits ~22–30°C (72–86°F) but central regions see typhoon rains; the south remains steamy. That helps the family plan around their mild-weather preference and safe outdoor time for the boys.

North Vietnam cools to 15–22°C (59–72°F) with damp chill; southern cities hover near 23–31°C (73–88°F). That helps the family plan around their mild-weather preference and safe outdoor time for the boys.
Da Nang, Nha Trang, and Phu Quoc provide warm beaches, though water cleanliness varies with season and development. It shapes the family's weekend escapes when they need green space and fresh air.
Coastal waters stay about 25–29°C (77–84°F) year-round, comfortable for swimming. It shapes the family's weekend escapes when they need green space and fresh air.
Karst bays, terraced highlands, and national parks like Phong Nha offer dramatic scenery and outdoor excursions. It shapes the family's weekend escapes when they need green space and fresh air.
Regional monthly minimum wages range 3.25–4.68M VND (~$130–190 USD), low for international families. Trey and Sarah factor this into balancing remote work with any local tech roles.

Mid-level developers in Ho Chi Minh City earn roughly $18k–35k USD yearly, boosted by low living costs but modest globally. Trey and Sarah factor this into balancing remote work with any local tech roles.
Firms such as FPT Software and NashTech run sizable .NET teams, yet competition for higher-paying roles is stiff. Trey and Sarah factor this into balancing remote work with any local tech roles.
Ruby roles are niche, concentrated in a few startups and outsourcing houses, limiting opportunities for Sarah. Trey and Sarah factor this into balancing remote work with any local tech roles.

Work permits require employer sponsorship, degree proof, and criminal checks; reputable firms manage the paperwork but expect lead time. Trey and Sarah factor this into balancing remote work with any local tech roles.
Vietnam posts ~5–6% GDP growth with expanding manufacturing and services, though inflation spikes occasionally. Trey and Sarah factor this into balancing remote work with any local tech roles.
Ho Chi Minh City and Da Nang host coworking hubs and reliable fiber, but time zones complicate US collaboration. Trey and Sarah factor this into balancing remote work with any local tech roles.
Export-oriented companies often expect overtime, though some tech firms embrace flexible schedules. This directly affects Sarah's need for a calmer rhythm and shared family evenings.
Labor law caps at 48 hours; many offices run 44–48, with overtime during peak projects. This directly affects Sarah's need for a calmer rhythm and shared family evenings.
Employees receive 12 paid days plus public holidays, modest compared with Europe. This directly affects Sarah's need for a calmer rhythm and shared family evenings.
International employers may offer 15–18 days, but local firms rarely exceed the statutory minimum. This directly affects Sarah's need for a calmer rhythm and shared family evenings.

Ho Chi Minh City is fast-paced, while Da Nang and Hue offer a calmer lifestyle that could suit Sarah’s slower preference. This directly affects Sarah's need for a calmer rhythm and shared family evenings.

Offices commonly run 8:00–17:30 with a long lunch; schools start near 7:30 and finish mid-afternoon, requiring after-school plans. This directly affects Sarah's need for a calmer rhythm and shared family evenings.

Weekends revolve around morning markets, café meetups, and family outings before hot afternoons drive people indoors. This directly affects Sarah's need for a calmer rhythm and shared family evenings.
Family-centric culture values children, yet public spaces can be crowded and sidewalks uneven for strollers. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
Non-monogamous relationships lack legal recognition and remain socially taboo; discretion would be essential. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
Schools and relatives emphasize academic achievement and respect for elders, creating pressure for kids to conform. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.

Urban parks and indoor play spaces exist but are limited; traffic and air quality require vigilance with young children. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.

Public schools are Vietnamese-language and test-heavy; international schools in major cities offer English curricula at high tuition. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
Private preschools and bilingual Montessori options operate in cities, yet quality varies and waitlists can be long. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
State subsidies are modest; extended family often fills gaps, leaving formal childcare uneven. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
Foreign families rely on pricey international preschools or nannies, with little government assistance. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
Citizens access free-to-low-cost public schools, though rural quality gaps remain. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.

Foreign children may enroll in public schools but face language and bureaucratic barriers; most choose private options. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
International Baccalaureate and British schools deliver high-quality programs at $15k–30k USD per child annually. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
Maternity leave lasts 6 months at partial pay and child allowances are small, offering moderate support. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
Foreign workers generally follow employer policies with limited statutory benefits beyond basic leave. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
Public universities are affordable and expanding, especially in engineering and IT. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
International programs accept foreign students, though language readiness and paperwork add friction. Those conditions determine how easily Anduin and Alasdair can thrive day to day.
Traditional gender expectations persist, yet urban professionals increasingly support dual-career households. Their progressive, polyamory-positive values make this climate especially important.
Legal recognition for trans and nonbinary identities is minimal, though youth culture is slowly more accepting. Their progressive, polyamory-positive values make this climate especially important.
Gender equality laws exist, but wage gaps and limited political representation remain challenges. Their progressive, polyamory-positive values make this climate especially important.
Women face pressure toward modest dress and family caregiving, especially outside major metros. Their progressive, polyamory-positive values make this climate especially important.
Men are expected to be primary earners and defer to elders, with growing acceptance of softer roles in cities. Their progressive, polyamory-positive values make this climate especially important.

Dynamic street food scenes, French-colonial architecture, and UNESCO sites create constant exploration opportunities. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Vietnamese is dominant; English proficiency is improving in tech hubs but drops sharply outside cities. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Social policy is cautious and the one-party state limits activism, offering limited progressive reforms. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Official ideology remains socialist, though daily life blends market pragmatism with party messaging. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
State is officially atheist, yet folk Buddhism and ancestor worship are widely practiced. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Public discussion of sexuality is conservative; sex education is limited and discretion is expected. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Same-sex marriage is neither recognized nor outlawed; urban Pride events exist but stigma persists. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Tight-knit neighborhoods, night markets, and expat groups foster connection if you engage locally. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Vietnamese pride centers on resilience, entrepreneurial hustle, and hospitality toward guests. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Relations with ASEAN neighbors are pragmatic, while maritime disputes with China create wariness. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.

values.key: View of Them by Neighboring Countries
values.alignmentText: Vietnam is seen as a fast-growing manufacturing hub and reliable regional partner, though rivalry with China lingers. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Major cities offer lively rooftop bars, craft beer spots, and late-night street food. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Young men mix casual streetwear with office formalwear; tailored shirts and sneakers dominate. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Women blend ao dai heritage with modern Korean-influenced styles, balancing modesty and flair. It signals how comfortably their progressive, gaming-friendly lifestyle would mesh locally.
Soccer, badminton, karaoke, and motorbike road trips are popular pastimes. Shared hobbies and inclusive scenes help Trey keep gaming and Sarah build community.
Board game cafés in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City host small but growing communities. Shared hobbies and inclusive scenes help Trey keep gaming and Sarah build community.
Live music venues range from jazz clubs to indie gigs, though noise curfews can end nights early. Shared hobbies and inclusive scenes help Trey keep gaming and Sarah build community.
Tech meetups, language exchanges, and parenting groups meet regularly in expat districts. Shared hobbies and inclusive scenes help Trey keep gaming and Sarah build community.
Weekend trips reach national parks, highland retreats like Da Lat, and scenic coastal drives. Shared hobbies and inclusive scenes help Trey keep gaming and Sarah build community.
One-party socialist republic led by the Communist Party with centralized decision-making. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
The state is officially secular and restricts religious influence on governance. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
Unions are state-run and strikes require approval, limiting independent labor advocacy. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
The party promotes a socialist-oriented market economy and collective prosperity narrative. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
Media censorship, anti-dissent laws, and recent arrests of activists indicate high authoritarian risk. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
A hybrid economy welcomes foreign investment while strategic sectors stay under state guidance. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
Political stability is strong with predictable leadership transitions and low civil unrest. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
State media and billboards deliver unified messaging on development and patriotism. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
Narratives emphasize economic growth, party loyalty, and national sovereignty. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
Programs target poverty reduction and rural development but civil liberties remain constrained. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
Surveys show moderate trust in central authorities, though locals often question lower-level corruption. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
Transparency International scores Vietnam mid-low due to petty bribery and opaque procurement. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
Facilitation payments for permits and state-linked business favoritism are the most cited issues. They prioritize resilient democracies with transparent institutions for their kids' future.
Rapid condo development offers modern units, yet expat rents in top districts are rising quickly. The family must weigh proximity to schools and air quality against budget flexibility.
Violent crime is rare, but petty theft and motorbike accidents are common urban risks. Trey and Sarah would plan extra street-safety routines for the boys.
Universal health insurance covers basic care, yet overcrowded public hospitals limit quality. Reliable public services are critical for the children's schooling, healthcare, and mobility.

Private hospitals deliver high-quality care with English-speaking staff at moderate costs compared with the US. Reliable public services are critical for the children's schooling, healthcare, and mobility.
Working parents rely on grandparents or private caregivers; formal state programs remain limited. Reliable public services are critical for the children's schooling, healthcare, and mobility.
Families receive modest cash allowances and tuition reductions, but benefits rarely cover actual costs. Reliable public services are critical for the children's schooling, healthcare, and mobility.

STEM achievement is strong, yet rote learning and class sizes may clash with progressive pedagogy preferences. Reliable public services are critical for the children's schooling, healthcare, and mobility.

Urban buses are widespread; Ho Chi Minh City’s first metro line opens soon but mass transit remains limited. Reliable public services are critical for the children's schooling, healthcare, and mobility.
Socialist-oriented market economy balancing state-owned giants with vibrant private SMEs. It guides household budgeting and Trey's entrepreneurship planning.
Personal income tax is progressive (5–35%) with monthly payroll withholding and annual reconciliation. It guides household budgeting and Trey's entrepreneurship planning.
At moderate expat salaries, effective income tax would likely land near 10–15% plus social insurance contributions. It guides household budgeting and Trey's entrepreneurship planning.
Digital wallets like MoMo and widespread QR payments coexist with a still-cash-heavy culture. It guides household budgeting and Trey's entrepreneurship planning.
Housing, food, and services remain far below US costs, enabling significant savings if schooling is managed. It guides household budgeting and Trey's entrepreneurship planning.
State pensions are modest and depend on long contribution histories, prompting reliance on family support. It guides household budgeting and Trey's entrepreneurship planning.
No dedicated retirement visa; long-stay options require investment or marriage, limiting ease for foreigners. It guides household budgeting and Trey's entrepreneurship planning.

Options include work permits with temporary residence cards, investor visas, and marriage visas, each with layered paperwork. Visa stability is essential so the household can settle without disruption.
Locals are generally friendly to Americans, but immigration bureaucracy and language barriers temper the welcome. Visa stability is essential so the household can settle without disruption.
Temporary residence cards typically last 1–3 years and require ongoing employer or investment sponsorship. Visa stability is essential so the household can settle without disruption.
Naturalization demands 5+ years’ residence, language fluency, and usually renouncing prior citizenship. Visa stability is essential so the household can settle without disruption.
Spouses and children can obtain dependent residence tied to the principal visa holder. Visa stability is essential so the household can settle without disruption.
Work permit and TRC processing often take 2–3 months with fees in the hundreds of USD plus translation costs. Visa stability is essential so the household can settle without disruption.
Quarterly reporting, local police registrations, and sudden rule changes require ongoing diligence. Visa stability is essential so the household can settle without disruption.
Vietnam allows limited dual citizenship, but naturalizing foreigners are commonly asked to renounce prior passports. Visa stability is essential so the household can settle without disruption.
Keeping notarized translations, health checks, and employer paperwork current is essential to avoid fines. Visa stability is essential so the household can settle without disruption.
Studios like VNG, Sparx*, and Glass Egg (Virtuos) employ large art and engineering teams serving global clients. Trey's hope to launch a game studio depends on ecosystems like this.
Key players include VNG Games, Sparx* (Virtuos), Gameloft Vietnam, and indie shop Emobi. Trey's hope to launch a game studio depends on ecosystems like this.
GameDev Vietnam, Global Game Jam chapters, and Saigon’s Indie Game Developers group host regular meetups. Trey's hope to launch a game studio depends on ecosystems like this.
Low burn rates and abundant art talent help early-stage studios, though funding networks remain nascent. Trey's hope to launch a game studio depends on ecosystems like this.
Fiber internet and new metro projects signal modern growth, yet power outages and uneven sidewalks persist. Solid infrastructure supports their remote work, gaming, and everyday logistics.

Dangerous extremes are routine, forcing us to track emergency alerts and modify plans multiple times a quarter. Seasonal Weather at 3/10 and Natural Disasters at 3/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for seasonal extremes & variability.

Months of oppressive darkness or bright nights disrupt sleep cycles and make remote work or study harder to sustain. Seasonal Weather at 3/10 and Environment at 5/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for seasonal sunlight hours.

Only brief shoulder weeks feel good; most months push us indoors due to muggy, icy, or stormy conditions. Seasonal Weather at 3/10 and Environment at 5/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for pleasant weather windows.

Families regularly compromise on safety or overcrowd to stay housed; civic support is patchy. Minimum Wage at 3/10, Housing Situation at 5/10, and Childcare Support (Citizens) at 4/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for quality of life – lower-income tier.

We feel squeezed: decent neighborhoods or schools require long commutes or high costs that crowd out enrichment. Typical Software Salaries at 5/10, Housing Situation at 5/10, and Work-Life Balance at 4/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for quality of life – middle-income tier.

Premium experiences exist but feel overpriced, shallow, or socially frowned upon. Housing Situation at 5/10, Private Education at 5/10, and Family Life at 5/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for quality of life – higher-income tier.

values.key: Spacious Housing Benchmark (2k sq ft Rent)
values.alignmentText: Large rentals appear occasionally and move fast, demanding premium rent or broker connections. Housing Situation at 5/10 and Cost of Living (Optional) at 8/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for spacious housing benchmark (2k sq ft rent).

Opportunities are sporadic; we rely on informal networks or satellite towns to join community living models. Community Vibes at 6/10, Meetups & Communities at 6/10, and Family Life at 5/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for community living opportunities.

Surface politeness exists yet deeper support systems take sustained effort to unlock. Community Vibes at 6/10, Meetups & Communities at 6/10, and Common Hobbies at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for friendliness & neighborliness index.

Negative media framing and policy tightenings create a defensive posture for newcomers. Welcoming of US Migrants at 5/10, Progressivism at 3/10, and Language & English Ubiquity at 4/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for immigrant sentiment – general.

Suspicion around privilege is common, demanding constant humility and proof of local investment. Welcoming of US Migrants at 5/10, Language & English Ubiquity at 4/10, and View of Them by Neighboring Countries at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for immigrant sentiment – white migrants.

Interactions can be efficient yet emotionally flat; kindness takes effort to elicit. Community Vibes at 6/10, Nightlife Culture at 7/10, and Common Hobbies at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for surface interaction norms.

Social circles are slow to open; we need persistence and shared projects to connect deeply. Community Vibes at 6/10, Meetups & Communities at 6/10, and What Is Intriguing at 7/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for depth-seeking social norms.

Touchy or crowded norms are common and require constant boundary setting. Community Vibes at 6/10, Sex (Attitudes) at 3/10, and View of self at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for personal boundary & bubble norms.

Honesty is situational; locals may avoid uncomfortable topics entirely. Progressivism at 3/10, What Is Intriguing at 7/10, and Trust in Government at 5/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for moral, honesty & openness expectations.

Noticeable emphasis on grooming means we budget extra time and money to fit in. Fashion Trends (Male) at 6/10 and Fashion Trends (Female) at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for grooming & beauty investment.

Visible pressure to stay slim or athletic influences work and school culture. Fashion Trends (Male) at 6/10, Fashion Trends (Female) at 6/10, and Sex (Attitudes) at 3/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for body image & fitness pressure.

Fashionable appearance is expected in many settings, adding planning time and costs. Fashion Trends (Male) at 6/10 and Fashion Trends (Female) at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for fashion & style expectations.

Consent education is weak; unwanted advances occur regularly. Sex (Attitudes) at 3/10, LGBTQ+ Attitudes at 4/10, and Nightlife Culture at 7/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for flirting boundaries & consent culture.

Rigid gender expectations create discomfort for progressive or queer expressions. Gender Roles at 5/10, Gender Fluidity at 3/10, and Sex (Attitudes) at 3/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for gendered flirting expectations.

Negative narratives dominate; openness threatens custody, employment, or housing. Polyamory at 1/10, Sex (Attitudes) at 3/10, and Community Vibes at 6/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for monogamy vs. non-monogamy acceptance.

Conservative norms dominate; promiscuity is equated with poor character. Sex (Attitudes) at 3/10, Nightlife & Music at 6/10, and Community Vibes at 6/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for promiscuity attitudes.

Disclosure triggers backlash or official scrutiny. Polyamory at 1/10, Community Vibes at 6/10, and LGBTQ+ Attitudes at 4/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for group & multi-partner relationship attitudes.

Culture favors close contact; sensory-sensitive family members often feel overwhelmed. Community Vibes at 6/10, Sex (Attitudes) at 3/10, and Nightlife Culture at 7/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for personal space & touch norms.

Permissive laws and visible ownership prompt caution in public spaces. Safety & Crime at 6/10, State Ideology at 4/10, and Political System at 2/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for firearm laws & ownership culture.

Zero-tolerance stances lead to aggressive policing and limited treatment options. Progressivism at 3/10, Political System at 2/10, and Safety & Crime at 6/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for controlled substance policies.

Aggressive tactics and profiling are common, eroding trust in authorities. Safety & Crime at 6/10, Progressivism at 3/10, and Authoritarian Backsliding Risk at 2/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for drug enforcement climate.
Multiple incidents within the past decade impact how we choose schools and venues. Safety & Crime at 6/10 and Stability at 7/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for mass violence incidence.

Conditions are degrading with widespread labor exploitation and violence. Authoritarian Backsliding Risk at 2/10, Safety & Crime at 6/10, and Perceived Corruption at 3/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for carceral conditions & prison labor.

Walking is possible yet stressful due to gaps in sidewalks or aggressive driving. Public Transportation at 4/10, Housing Situation at 5/10, and Nature Access at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for walkability & pedestrian safety.

Public health messaging is uneven; we invest extra time to maintain routines. Healthcare (Citizens) at 5/10, Work-Life Balance at 4/10, and Community Vibes at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for community health consciousness.

Ultra-processed options crowd shelves; schools and events lean heavily on packaged snacks. Cost of Living (Optional) at 8/10, Community Health Consciousness at 5/10, and Fresh & International Cuisine Access at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for processed food saturation.

Fresh options exist yet international diversity is limited to a few neighborhoods. Nightlife & Music at 6/10, Common Hobbies at 6/10, and Meetups & Communities at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for fresh & international cuisine access.

Prevalence is high with long waits and patchy insurance coverage. Seasonal Weather at 3/10, Work-Life Balance at 4/10, and Community Vibes at 6/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for depression prevalence.

Obesity is widespread, signaling systemic lifestyle challenges we must counter individually. Community Health Consciousness at 5/10, Work-Life Balance at 4/10, and Cost of Living (Optional) at 8/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for obesity rate.

Higher cancer rates tie to environmental or lifestyle factors we must actively mitigate. Environment at 5/10, Healthcare (Citizens) at 5/10, and Community Health Consciousness at 5/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for cancer incidence.

Recessions hit noticeable segments, requiring flexibility or retraining. Economic Health at 6/10, Remote-Friendly Culture at 6/10, and Typical Software Salaries at 5/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for broader job market resilience.
